name: Animal hijinks
description: As long as stories have been told on screen, audiences have loved films, TV shows, memes and videogames about animals being naughty. This constellation shares some key examples of animal comedy throughout the ages.

key_work.title: Cult of the Lamb
key_work.brief_description: Massive Monster’s Cult of the Lamb is a dungeon crawler with a difference, which combines classic dungeon crawling with gentler pastimes like home decoration and base building.

constellations_primary.name: Animal hijinks
constellations_primary.description: As long as stories have been told on screen, audiences have loved films, TV shows, memes and videogames about animals being naughty. This constellation shares some key examples of animal comedy throughout the ages.

start.title: Who framed Roger Rabbit?
start.creator_credit: Robert Zemeckis, Frank Marshall, Robert Watts, Amblin Entertainment and Touchstone Pictures
start.brief_description: A magical blend of live-acting and animation that comes off brilliantly due to the super effort by Bob Hoskins in playing to imaginary “co-stars” who were drawn in later. Hoskins plays Eddie Valiant, a has-been gumshoe in the ‘40s film noir mould who comes out of a self enforced retirement. Someone is out to steal Toon Town from the cartoon characters who inhabit the magical land. To get their hands on the valuable property they frame its biggest star, Roger Rabbit for murder. Detective Valiant must solve the case and save the toons. Cast also includes Christopher Lloyd, Joanna Cassidy, Stubby Kaye and Charles Fleisher. Based on the story “Who censored Roger Rabbit?” by Gary K. Wolf and winner of four Academy Awards.

constellations_other.name: Animal hijinks
constellations_other.description: As long as stories have been told on screen, audiences have loved films, TV shows, memes and videogames about animals being naughty. This constellation shares some key examples of animal comedy throughout the ages.

end.title: Dr. Jekyll and Mr. Mouse
end.creator_credit: Joseph Barbera, William Hanna, Robert Louis Stevenson, Fred Quimby, Metro-Goldwyn-Mayer and MGM Cartoon Studio
end.brief_description: Tom, sick of Jerry stealing the milk out of his bowl, poisons it. Instead of killing the mouse, the potion transforms him into a muscular beast.

constellations_other.name: Animal hijinks
constellations_other.description: As long as stories have been told on screen, audiences have loved films, TV shows, memes and videogames about animals being naughty. This constellation shares some key examples of animal comedy throughout the ages.

links.description: Who Framed Roger Rabbit (1988) renewed public interest in the golden age of American animation – an era that was full of naughty cartoon creatures. The iconic rivalry of TV series Tom and Jerry (1940-) is an iconic example of comedic animal hijinks from this period.

start.title: Dr. Jekyll and Mr. Mouse
start.creator_credit: Joseph Barbera, William Hanna, Robert Louis Stevenson, Fred Quimby, Metro-Goldwyn-Mayer and MGM Cartoon Studio
start.brief_description: Tom, sick of Jerry stealing the milk out of his bowl, poisons it. Instead of killing the mouse, the potion transforms him into a muscular beast.

end.title: Dogville Collection 1
end.brief_description: A collection of Dogville Comedy shorts, showcasing creatively costumed “talking” dogs of various breeds and spoofed thenoble and naughty behaviors of people. The first disc contains Hot Dog, College Hounds, Who Killed Rover?, The Dogway Melody, and So Quiet on the Canine Front.

constellations_other.name: Animal hijinks
constellations_other.description: As long as stories have been told on screen, audiences have loved films, TV shows, memes and videogames about animals being naughty. This constellation shares some key examples of animal comedy throughout the ages.

links.description: Long beforeefore Tom and Jerry (1940) stole the show, animal actors were used to spoof famous films. Dogville Comedy short films (1929) were remakes silent slapstick classics from Buster Keaton and Laurel and Hardie, replacing the lead actors with dogs.

start.title: Cult of the Lamb
start.brief_description: Massive Monster’s Cult of the Lamb is a dungeon crawler with a difference, which combines classic dungeon crawling with gentler pastimes like home decoration and base building.

constellations_primary.name: Animal hijinks

end.title: Silly symphonies
end.creator_credit: Walt Disney and Walt Disney Pictures
end.brief_description: Three Walt Disney cartoon classics from the Silly Symphony series which are sure to enchant and delight children of all ages. Walt Disney’s “Silly Symphonies” were produced over a ten-year period from 1929-1939 and have managed to continue charming and entertaining viewing audiences of all ages into the 21st century.

constellations_other.name: Animal hijinks
constellations_other.description: As long as stories have been told on screen, audiences have loved films, TV shows, memes and videogames about animals being naughty. This constellation shares some key examples of animal comedy throughout the ages.

links.description: Videogame Cult of the Lamb (2022) follows a lamb who escapes the sacrificial altar, starting a cult of their own. Like Mickey Mouse, who plays the insubordinate wizard’s apprentice in an early edition of Silly Symphonies (1929), our lamb upsets the hierarchy to chaotic – and comedic – effect.

start.title: Space Jam
start.creator_credit: Joe Pytka, Sheldon Kahn, Marlene Stewart, Daniel Goldberg, Ivan Reitman, Joe Medjuck, Courtside Seats Productions, Northern Lights Entertainment, Warner Bros. Animation, Warner Bros. Pictures, Fred Cline, Geoffrey Kirkland, Chris Darroca, Earl A. Hibbert, Edwin Shortess, Herschel Weingrod, Leo Benvenuti, Steve Rudnick and Timothy Harris
start.brief_description: Jokes fly as the Tune Squad takes on the Nerdlucks in a hardcourt game to decide if the Looney Tunes remain here… or become attractions at a far-off galactic off-ramp called Moron Mountain. The Nerdlucks have a monstrous secret weapon: they’ve stolen the skills of top NBA stars like Charles Barkley and Patrick Ewing and become Monstars. But that’s not all, folks. The Tune Squad’s secret weapon just happens to be the finest player in this or any other universe. He’s outta this world. So’s the fun.

constellations_other.description: As long as stories have been told on screen, audiences have loved films, TV shows, memes and videogames about animals being naughty. This constellation shares some key examples of animal comedy throughout the ages.

links.description: Almost ten years before Space Jam (1996) hit cinemas, Who Framed Roger Rabbit (1988) combines cartoon with live-action for comedic effect, telling the story of a cartoon rabbit who is framed for murder by the evil Judge Doom.

start.title: Silly symphonies
start.creator_credit: Walt Disney and Walt Disney Pictures
start.brief_description: Three Walt Disney cartoon classics from the Silly Symphony series which are sure to enchant and delight children of all ages. Walt Disney’s “Silly Symphonies” were produced over a ten-year period from 1929-1939 and have managed to continue charming and entertaining viewing audiences of all ages into the 21st century.

end.title: Space Jam
end.creator_credit: Joe Pytka, Sheldon Kahn, Marlene Stewart, Daniel Goldberg, Ivan Reitman, Joe Medjuck, Courtside Seats Productions, Northern Lights Entertainment, Warner Bros. Animation, Warner Bros. Pictures, Fred Cline, Geoffrey Kirkland, Chris Darroca, Earl A. Hibbert, Edwin Shortess, Herschel Weingrod, Leo Benvenuti, Steve Rudnick and Timothy Harris
end.brief_description: Jokes fly as the Tune Squad takes on the Nerdlucks in a hardcourt game to decide if the Looney Tunes remain here… or become attractions at a far-off galactic off-ramp called Moron Mountain. The Nerdlucks have a monstrous secret weapon: they’ve stolen the skills of top NBA stars like Charles Barkley and Patrick Ewing and become Monstars. But that’s not all, folks. The Tune Squad’s secret weapon just happens to be the finest player in this or any other universe. He’s outta this world. So’s the fun.

constellations_other.name: Animal hijinks
constellations_other.description: As long as stories have been told on screen, audiences have loved films, TV shows, memes and videogames about animals being naughty. This constellation shares some key examples of animal comedy throughout the ages.

links.description: Space Jam (1996) combined famous Loony Tunes characters, many of whom were inspired by characters in Silly Symphonies (1929), with real actors to emphasise the cartoonish qualities of its animal cast members. It was also one of the first animated films to employ digital techniques.
